issue.title: [R] Document mapping of Arrow <-> R types
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3446](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3446). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Expanded scope to include documenting all types. 

-----
Previous description:

uint8, int16, uint16 -> int32

uint32 -> numeric

int64, uint64 -> ?

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3446?focusedCommentId=16705340) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Thoughts about this? cc `[~hadley]` `[~javierluraschi]`

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3446?focusedCommentId=16705388) by Javier Luraschi (javierluraschi):*
Seems reasonable to me, in fact, I think this is already implemented as follows:
```java

uint8, int16, uint16 -> int32

uint32 -> numeric

int64, uint64 -> bit64
```
So we can wait on `[~romainfrancois]` to confirm but this one can probably be closed.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3446?focusedCommentId=16779643) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Can we close the loop on this, possibly documenting the issue?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3446?focusedCommentId=17137914) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Issue resolved by pull request 7441
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7441>
